poem:
**Knife-Edge Dance**

In the haze of November  
where words clash  
like wind on brittle leaves—  

a hand extended,  
another clenched,  

echoes linger  
in the sharp air;  

paths diverge,  
one gentle as shadows,  
the other,  
a storm of broken glass—  

each step,  
hope or tremor,  
etched in the earth's  
unseen gaze.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Harris and Trump pushed to extreme plays for support in knife-edge race With just half a month to go, the US presidential election is deadlocked, as Kamala Harris and Donald Trump jockey for any advantage in ways that illuminate their stark political differences; the Democratic nominee most recently announced a plan to campaign with the Obamas, while the Republican nominee doubles down on threatening his enemies. In the past week, Trump has gone further than". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
